data.text: For thine incorruptible Spirit is in all things.
Therefore chastenest thou them by little and little that offend,
For it was thy will to destroy by the hands of our fathers
Whom thou hatedst for doing
And also those merciless murderers of children,
With their priests out of the midst of their idolatrous crew,
That the land, which thou esteemedst above all other,
Nevertheless even those thou sparedst as men,
Not that thou wast unable to bring the ungodly under the hand of the righteous in battle,
But executing thy judgments upon them by little and little, thou gavest them place of repentance,
For it was a cursed seed from the beginning;
For who shall say, What hast thou done?
For neither is there any God but thou that careth for all,
Neither shall king or tyrant be able to set his face against thee for any whom thou hast punished.
Forsomuch then as thou art righteous thyself, thou orderest all things righteously:
For thy power is the beginning of righteousness,
For when men will not believe that thou art of a full power, thou showest thy strength,
But thou, mastering thy power, judgest with equity,
But by such works hast thou taught thy people
For if thou didst punish the enemies of thy children, and the condemned to death, with such deliberation,
With how great circumspection didst thou judge thine own sons,
Therefore, whereas thou dost chasten us, thou scourgest our enemies a thousand times more,
Wherefore, whereas men have lived dissolutely and unrighteously,
For they went astray very far in the ways of error,
Therefore unto them, as to children without the use of reason,
But they that would not be reformed by that correction, wherein he dallied with them,
For, look, for what things they grudged, when they were punished,
